Posts.Title: Long Term Survivor with Active Mets 15andmore 15andmore

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2011 05:34PM Wreni wrote: 15 and more.  Your post touched me and inspired hope at the same time.  I cannot speak with the years of experience you have, but have had bilat mastectomies, triple-agent chemo, Arimidex with bone mets diagnosed 5 years after the initial diagnosis.  This was treated with palliative radiation and the Arimidex was changed to Tamoxafen and I was started on Zometa via a new port.  IE, I am not a NOOB to treatment and set-backs.  Last week I had an MRI and PET scan for re-staging and both, miraculously, were clean, but I am so Tired of the medical mill and fighting this disease.  I feel like a human pin-cushion.  From what I read of your post is that your complicated disease is being managed but you sound so Tired of doing what needs to be done to stay in the management mode.  I can entirely sympathazize.  I sometimes seem to live life waiting for the second shoe to drop and I have to stop and remind myself that this kind of thinking is counter-productive and that living life fully in the moment is where it's at.  Hugs and peace.  ~w
